1.brief: to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
to dash in pieces, literally or figuratively (especially to disperse)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
a hemming in, i.e. (objectively) a mound (of siege), or (subjectively) a rampart (of protection), (abstractly) fortification
properly, to lean forward, i.e. to peer into the distance; by implication, to observe, await
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
properly, the waist or small of the back; only in plural the loins
to be alert, physically (on foot) or mentally (in courage)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)

2.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to pour out, i.e. to empty, figuratively, to depopulate; by analogy, to spread out (as a fruitful vine)
to pour out, i.e. to empty, figuratively, to depopulate; by analogy, to spread out (as a fruitful vine)
to decay, i.e. (causatively) ruin (literally or figuratively)

3.brief: a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength
to crimson, i.e. dye that color
a cleaver, i.e. iron armature (of a chariot)
a vehicle; by implication, a team; by extension, cavalry; by analogy a rider, i.e. the upper millstone
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
a cypress (?) tree; hence, a lance or a musical instrument (as made of that wood)

4.brief: properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
a vehicle; by implication, a team; by extension, cavalry; by analogy a rider, i.e. the upper millstone
to course (like a beast of prey); by implication, to seek greedily
a width, i.e. (concretely) avenue or area
a view (the act of seeing); also an appearance (the thing seen), whether (real) a shape (especially if handsome, comeliness; often plural the looks), or (mental) a vision
lightning; by analogy, a gleam; concretely, a flashing sword
to run (for whatever reason, especially to rush)

5.brief: properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall
a walking; by implication, a procession or march, a caravan
properly, to be liquid or flow easily, i.e. (by implication); to hurry (in a good or a bad sense); often used (with another verb) adverbially, promptly

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
properly, to entwine as ascreen; by implication, to fence in, cover over, (figuratively) protect

6.brief: an opening, i.e. door or gate
a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
a large public building, such as a palace or temple
to melt, i.e. literally (to soften, flow down, disappear), or figuratively (to fear, faint)

7.brief: to station, in various applications (literally or figuratively)
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
to drive forth (a person, an animal or chariot), i.e. lead, carry away; reflexively, to proceed (i.e. impel or guide oneself); also (from the panting induced by effort), to sigh
a dove (apparently from the warmth of their mating)
to drum, i.e. play (as) on the tambourine
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the heart (as the most interior organ);

8.brief: a reservoir (at which camels kneel as a resting-place)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to flit, i.e. vanish away (subside, escape; causatively, chase, impel, deliver)
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to turn; by implication, to face, i.e. appear, look, etc.

9.brief: silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
adjustment, i.e. structure; by implication, equipage
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
something prepared, i.e. any apparatus (as an implement, utensil, dress, vessel or weapon)

10.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to liquefy; figuratively, to waste (with disease), to faint (with fatigue, fear or grief)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, the waist or small of the back; only in plural the loins
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, illuminated, i.e. a glow; as noun, a flush (of anxiety)

11.brief: an abode, of God (the Tabernacle or the Temple), men (their home) or animals (their lair); hence, a retreat (asylum)
pasture (the place or the act); also the haunt of wild animals

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
a village (as covered in by walls); also a young lion (perhaps as covered with a mane)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
to roar; a lion (properly, a lioness as the fiercer (although not a roarer;))
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
a cub (as still abiding in the lair), especially of the lion
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to shudder with terror; hence, to fear; also to hasten (with anxiety)

12.brief: to pluck off or pull to pieces; causatively to supply with food (as in morsels)
enough (as noun or adverb), used chiefly with preposition in phrases
{a cub (as still abiding in the lair), especially of the lion}
to be narrow; by implication, to throttle, or (reflex.) to choke oneself to death (by a rope)
to roar; a lion (properly, a lioness as the fiercer (although not a roarer;))
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
something torn, i.e. a fragment, e.g. a fresh leaf, prey, food
{an abode, of God (the Tabernacle or the Temple), men (their home) or animals (their lair); hence, a retreat (asylum)}
prey, i.e. flocks devoured by animals

13.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
smoke, literally or figuratively (vapor, dust, anger)
a vehicle; by implication, a team; by extension, cavalry; by analogy a rider, i.e. the upper millstone
a village (as covered in by walls); also a young lion (perhaps as covered with a mane)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
something torn, i.e. a fragment, e.g. a fresh leaf, prey, food
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)

14.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
smoke, literally or figuratively (vapor, dust, anger)
a vehicle; by implication, a team; by extension, cavalry; by analogy a rider, i.e. the upper millstone
a village (as covered in by walls); also a young lion (perhaps as covered with a mane)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement

the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
something torn, i.e. a fragment, e.g. a fresh leaf, prey, food
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
